definition: lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Its features were partly visible in the 2005 British parliamentary elections.
sentences.chinese: 有些特徵可在2005年英國的議會選舉中略見一斑。

sentences.english: Just consider the raw increase in the number of journals.
sentences.chinese: 只要看看科研期刊數量的增長就可略見一斑了。
素食論的虛僞，從此可以略見一斑。
